ing: 1 1/2 teaspoons blackening seasoning (such as Chef Paul Prudhomme's Blackened Redfish MagicÂ®)
2 cups raw pumpkin seeds, rinsed and dried
des: "I whipped up this easy recipe after carving Halloween pumpkins and decided to add a little flavor to the seeds by using Chef Paul Prudhomme'sÂ® seasoning. You can use other mixes or you own choice of meat seasoning to make an equally delicious fall treat."
ins:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Combine butter, seasoning, and salt in a bowl. Add seeds; stir with a spoon until coated. Spread in a single layer on the baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crisp, about 45 minutes.
